docs.text: after enduring mariah carey's film debut , glitter , i'm reminded of a bit from chris rock's bigger and blacker .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in response to women saying that they can raise a child without a man , rock says , " you can drive a car with your feet , but that don't mean it should be done . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to that i say , you can give mariah carey a movie , but that certainly don't mean it should be done .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sure , there are plenty of pop star film vehicles out there -- from the beatles' a hard day's night to the spice girls' spice world -- but none have been so vapidly pointless or laughable as glitter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everything about this complete tripe is ludicrous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: start off with the story , which -- as gruesomely predictable as it is -- is the least offensive part of the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is inexplicably set in the 80s , a period piece that really shows no sign of its period except for a few chicks in leg warmers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: worse yet , everyone's speaking late 90s hip-hop slang in what should be 1983 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: meant to be partially autobiographical , carey plays billie frank , a young singer in new york who struggles to overcome a rough childhood and abandonment by her alcoholic mother .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: influential club dj julian dice , a . k . a . " lucky 7 " ( max beesley playing a bad mix of puff daddy and robert de niro ) , hears her sing on a track , and decides to make her a star .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in predictably rapid succession , billie and dice fall for each other , she starts hitting it big , dice gets jealous and starts acting like an ass , and suddenly billie's on " the roller coaster of superstardom . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the meantime , billie is on an emotional hunt for her missing mom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i won't give away the ending , but -- honestly -- just think of unicorns and rainbows . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you'll figure it out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie screams to be made with camp , and that could've been fun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the filmmakers thought making the bulk of glitter weepy and dramatic would be better .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what a mistake .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the brief attempts at comic relief -- as in a scene where an effeminate russian-sounding director gets wacky with filming billie's first music video -- go over like lead balloons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , the audience at my screening tended to laugh loudest during mariah's most dramatic scenes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: which brings us to the performances , of which there's nothing good that can be said .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mariah is primarily seen with a wide-eyed deer-in-the-headlights look frozen on her face .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she actually looks scared during her one love scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but you have to wonder if the writing isn't even worse .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so much of the dialogue is so hackneyed and watered down for carey's virginal target audience that it's probably impossible for any actor to pull it off with aplomb .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even the characters couldn't have been written more absurdly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they're all members of a barbie playset : the important film director who swoons , " billie , i'd love to put you in a movie i'm making , " and the big-time record executive who takes billie's demo tape and says , " oh , i'll make sure the whole team listens to it in the morning . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everyone in the film is a device , and it's painful to keep watching just to see another one appear .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to say more would be a waste .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's so much wrong with this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and , it pains me that mariah carey -- with her ego and sanity in such fragile condition these days , as evidenced by her multiple hospital stays -- will have to suffer through all the negative reviews she's likely to get .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , then again , i had to suffer through her movie .
docs.label: negative
